snippet: Five months into Harvey’s first season back from Tommy John surgery, a debate has arisen over how much he should pitch in the final month of the season.
abstract: New York Mets and pitcher Matt Harvey's agent Scott Boras are in sharp disagreement over Harvey's innings limit; Boras says as a former Tommy John patient Harvey should not pitch more than 180 innings, which would prevent him from pitching in playoffs.
lead_paragraph: Five months into Harvey’s first season back from Tommy John surgery, a debate has arisen over how much he should pitch in the final month of the season.

headline.main: Scott Boras and the Mets Disagree About Matt Harvey’s Innings Limit
headline.print_headline: Mets Should Limit Harvey’s Innings, His Agent Says
